metadata.title: CVE-2017-14977 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low
metadata.description:
The FoFiTrueType::getCFFBlock function in FoFiTrueType.cc in Poppler 0.59.0has a NULL pointer dereference vulnerability due to lack of validation of atable pointer, which allows an attacker to launch a denial of serviceattack.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-14977` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-poppler-0.18 - 0.24.5-2ubuntu4.7
libpoppler-cpp0 - 0.24.5-2ubuntu4.7
libpoppler-glib8 - 0.24.5-2ubuntu4.7
libpoppler-qt4-4 - 0.24.5-2ubuntu4.7
libpoppler-qt5-1 - 0.24.5-2ubuntu4.7
libpoppler44 - 0.24.5-2ubuntu4.7
poppler-utils - 0.24.5-2ubuntu4.7
No subscription required

criterions.comment: poppler package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.24.5-2ubuntu4.7').
